Christmas events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Nov 27, 2017

Whether you want to meet Father Christmas, pick up some presents, or enjoy some festive entertainment, we've got lots of Christmas events for all ages taking place across our libraries next month.

Jump to:

  • Fairs and get-togethers
  • Entertainment and games
  • Craft sessions
  • Events for children

Fairs and get-togethers

Meet Father Christmas and other special guests, pick up some Christmas gifts, try your luck in a competition or enjoy some festive food and drink.

Extended opening, children's activities and refreshments for late night shopping in Framlingham

Christmas Fun: Make a 2018 calendar

Fri 29 Dec 1030
Bungay Library

If you're feeling lonely or isolated, Elmswell Library are offering extra support this Christmas.

That's not all that's happening this month. Five of our libraries are hosting Librarian Theatre's production, Alice in the Cuckoo's Nest, and a few libraries are hosting Suffolk Libraries Presents screenings. Haverhill Library will be holding a Harry Potter book trail around the town as our Harry Potter: A History of Magic display moves there on 8 December.

If you're visiting our libraries over the festive period, remember to check our Christmas opening hours.
